instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01700 16" MBP A2141 dont turn on
threads.message:
Hi, just this device came in

20V draw with batterie 

no dong, no display


checked the power sequenz from repair wiki
[URL unfurl="true"]https://repair.wiki/w/A2141_2019_16%22_MacBook_Pro[/URL]

PMU_CLK32K_PCH is ok
PMU_ACTIVE_READY is 1.8V
PMU_ONOF_L is 3.3V
PP3V3_S5, PP1V8_S5 is 0V

R8013 Pin1 has a nice sinus wave

so it seems me the problem could be the PMU, what do you think?

threads.title: 820-01700 16" MBP A2141 dont turn on
threads.message:
Any history available?

Be aware, this machine requires 96, or 140W charger.
Do you get expected SLPS2R and AWAKE voltages?
It is recognized into DFU?

threads.title: 820-01700 16" MBP A2141 dont turn on
threads.message:
I use a laboratory power supply , until now that was good for all a2141

PP1V8_SLPS2R    1.81V
PP1V1_SLPS2R    1.11V
PP0V8_SLPS2R    0.81V

PP1V8_AWAKE    1.8V
PP3V3_AWAKE     3.36V
PPVDDCPUSRAM_AWAKE    0.81V
PP1V2_AWAKE   1.21V

the history is it stopped from one day top the other

I was sure that I had tried a recognition in DFU mode. Now, for the sake of order, I tried it again and how cool, it says RECOVERY on the display. Then I carried out all the necessary steps. The case can be closed. The problem has been solved.

Thanks to 2informations that I had not yet desoldered the PMU.
